required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Study of Acute Pancreatitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Afﬁliated Hospital of North Sichuan Medical College

clinical_study.source: Afﬁliated Hospital of North Sichuan Medical College

brief_summary.textblock: To quantitatively analyze the T2* values of the head, body, and tail of normal pancreas, and observe the value of GRE T2*-weighted MRI in the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis and the relationship between the T2* value and the severity of AP.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. We design a prospective study about "Magetic Resonance Imaging Study of Acute Pancreatitis".
2. We apply for an account and register our study on the clinicalTrials.
3. In patients with acute pancreatitis, imaging is recommended to confirm the clinical diagnosis, investigate the etiology, and grade the severity of the disease . MR had the excellent resolution of soft tissue，and it has earned an ever more important role in the diagnosis of AP. With the continuous development of MR scanning techniques, the sequence of a multi-echo gradient recalled echo (GRE) T2*-weighted imaging (T2*WI), which acquires a spin echo signal, T2* relaxation acquires a gradient echo signal, is a relatively new MRI technique. The sequence of a GRE T2*WI requires high uniformity of the magnetic field, plus it can provide the T2* value, which can indirectly reflect changes in tissue biochemical components, thus it can be used for the early diagnosis quantitative diagnosis of some diseases .
4. This calculation process for T2* value is completed using post-processing software on the workstation(Advantage workstation 4.4; GE Halthcare) directly after scanning.
5. AP is a process of inflammation diffusion, in which cell edema will lead to hydrogen proton increase. In the inflammatory exudation process, T2* value will change. So we conduct our research. In this study, we will observe pancreas in the normal pancreas and AP, and discuss the relationship between T2* value and that of AP graded by the MR severity index (MRSI) and Acute Physiology And Chronic Healthy Evaluation II (APACHE II) scores.
6. However, until now, there is no research on the sequence applied in the patients with AP.

primary_outcome.measure: The T2* Values in the Diagnosis of AP
primary_outcome.description: Compare the difference of the T2* value between the AP group and the control group.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Difference of T2* Value Between the Edematous AP and Necrotizing AP
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the difference of the T2* value between the edematous AP group and necrotizing AP group

secondary_outcome.measure: The T2* Value in Different Severity of AP According to MRSI
secondary_outcome.description: AP was graded as mild (0-3 points), moderate (4-6 points) or severe (7-10 points), according to the MR-severity index (MRSI) which was derived from the CT-severity index .

secondary_outcome.measure: The Relationship Between the T2* Value and the Severity of AP According to Apache II
secondary_outcome.description: In clinical practice, the physician usually used the APACHE II to evaluate the severity of acute pancreatitis. AP was graded as mild (0-7 points) and severe AP (≥8 points) according to the APACHE II scoring system.

arm_group.description: acute pancreatitis group：(a) acute onset of abdominal pain; (b) pancreatitis at first onset; (c) three-fold elevated amylase or lipase, excluding other causes of elevated enzymes; and (5) abdominal MR examination.

normal control group：without pancreatic disorders.The exclusion criteria in this study were as follows: (a) inability to cooperate when MR imaging was performed; (b) a history of chronic pancreatitis; (c) AP due to pancreatic carcinoma; (d) hypoproteinemia; and (e) with hypoproteinemia and other peritoneal/ retroperitoneal infection diseases ;(f) with iron deposition disorder (e.g. diabetes or blood system diseases).

study_pop.textblock: Patients with AP admitted to our institution between August 2013 and March 2015 were considered for inclusion in this study. The inclusion criteria for patients in this study were as follows: (a) acute onset of abdominal pain; (b) pancreatitis at first onset; (c) three-fold elevated amylase or lipase, excluding other causes of elevated enzymes; and (d) abdominal MR examination.

overall_official.affiliation: Afﬁliated Hospital of North Sichuan Medical College

facility.name: Afﬁliated Hospital of North Sichuan Medical College

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients with AP admitted to our institution between August 2013 and March 2015 were recruited in this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients with iron deposition disorder or chroic blood system diseases should be excluded in this study, because these diseases can lead to the change of the T2* value.

group.title: Acute Pancreatitis
group.description: acute pancreatitis group：(a) acute onset of abdominal pain; (b) pancreatitis at first onset; (c) three-fold elevated amylase or lipase, excluding other causes of elevated enzymes; and (5) abdominal MR examination.

group.title: Controlgroup
group.description: normal control group：without pancreatic disorders.The exclusion criteria in this study were as follows: (a) inability to cooperate when MR imaging was performed; (b) a history of chronic pancreatitis; (c) AP due to pancreatic carcinoma; (d) hypoproteinemia; and (e) with hypoproteinemia and other peritoneal/ retroperitoneal infection diseases ;(f) with iron deposition disorder (e.g. diabetes or blood system diseases).

group.title: Acute Pancreatitis
group.description: All AP patients underwent the MRI scan within three days after admission. All MRI examinations were performed with a 3.0T scanner (Discovery MR 750; GE Medical Systems, Milwaukee, Wis) in the supine position.

group.title: Controlgroup
group.description: All MRI examinations were performed with a 3.0T scanner (Discovery MR 750; GE Medical Systems, Milwaukee, Wis) in the supine position.

outcome.title: The T2* Values in the Diagnosis of AP
outcome.description: Compare the difference of the T2* value between the AP group and the control group.
outcome.population: compare T2* value between the AP group and the control group using independent sample t test

group.title: Acute Pancreatitis
group.description: T2* value of AP group is mean T2* values of the head, body and tail of pancreas respectively (If AP with necrosis, measureing the corresponding to the area with no necrosis).The AP group:(a) acute onset of abdominal pain; (b) pancreatitis at first onset; (c) three-fold elevated amylase or lipase, excluding other causes of elevated enzymes; and (5) abdominal MR examination

group.title: Control Group
group.description: T2* value of control group is mean T2* values of the head, body and tail of pancreas respectively.The control group:without pancreatic disorders

measure.title: The T2* Values in the Diagnosis of AP
measure.description: Compare the difference of the T2* value between the AP group and the control group.
measure.population: compare T2* value between the AP group and the control group using independent sample t test

analysis.groups_desc: The independent T test was used to determine the differences for the T2* value between the Control group and AP group.

outcome.title: The Difference of T2* Value Between the Edematous AP and Necrotizing AP
outcome.description: Compare the difference of the T2* value between the edematous AP group and necrotizing AP group
outcome.population: compare the difference of T2* value between the edematous AP and necrotizing AP

measure.title: The Difference of T2* Value Between the Edematous AP and Necrotizing AP
measure.description: Compare the difference of the T2* value between the edematous AP group and necrotizing AP group
measure.population: compare the difference of T2* value between the edematous AP and necrotizing AP

analysis.groups_desc: The independent T test was used to determine the differences for the T2* value between the edematous AP and necrotizing AP

outcome.title: The T2* Value in Different Severity of AP According to MRSI
outcome.description: AP was graded as mild (0-3 points), moderate (4-6 points) or severe (7-10 points), according to the MR-severity index (MRSI) which was derived from the CT-severity index .
outcome.population: AP was graded as mild (0-3 points), moderate (4-6 points) or severe (7-10 points), according to the MR-severity index (MRSI) which was derived from the CT-severity index .

group.title: Mild AP
group.description: Mild AP was defined as 0-3 points according to MRSI.

group.title: Moderate AP
group.description: Moderate AP was defined as 4-6 points according to MRSI.

group.title: Severe AP
group.description: Severe AP was defined as 7-10 points according to MRSI.

measure.title: The T2* Value in Different Severity of AP According to MRSI
measure.description: AP was graded as mild (0-3 points), moderate (4-6 points) or severe (7-10 points), according to the MR-severity index (MRSI) which was derived from the CT-severity index .
measure.population: AP was graded as mild (0-3 points), moderate (4-6 points) or severe (7-10 points), according to the MR-severity index (MRSI) which was derived from the CT-severity index .

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used to assess the differences in the T2* value between the mild, moderate, and severe AP groups according to the MRSI score.
compare the T2* value in the mild and moderate AP according to MRSI
compare the T2* value between the mild and severe AP
compare the T2* value between the moderate and severe AP according to MRSI

outcome.title: The Relationship Between the T2* Value and the Severity of AP According to Apache II
outcome.description: In clinical practice, the physician usually used the APACHE II to evaluate the severity of acute pancreatitis. AP was graded as mild (0-7 points) and severe AP (≥8 points) according to the APACHE II scoring system.

group.title: Mild AP
group.description: Mild AP was graded as the Apache II score ＜ 7 points.

group.title: Severe AP
group.description: Severe AP was graded as the Apache II score ≥8 points.

measure.title: The Relationship Between the T2* Value and the Severity of AP According to Apache II
measure.description: In clinical practice, the physician usually used the APACHE II to evaluate the severity of acute pancreatitis. AP was graded as mild (0-7 points) and severe AP (≥8 points) according to the APACHE II scoring system.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Some diseases, such as chronic anemia, diabetes, etc., may lead to iron deposition in pancreas and may lead to change the T2* value.

point_of_contact.organization: Sichuan Key Laboratory of Medical Imaging, Department of Radiology, Affiliated Hospital of North Sichuan Medical College
